newsitem.title: CYPRUS: Freak storm wreaks havoc in Cyprus.
newsitem.headline: Freak storm wreaks havoc in Cyprus.

text.p: A tornado wreaked havoc in Cyprus early on Thursday, uprooting trees and damaging homes, authorities said.
Nobody was injured during the storm, which hit shortly after midnight mainly around the British base of Dhekelia on the southeastern tip of the island.
"It was a mini cyclone which ripped through the area and caused significant damage to a refugee settlement," Mervyn Wynne-Jones, a spokesman for the British bases, told Reuters.
The perimeter wall of a local football stadium collapsed and the refugee estate was cordoned off for five hours while the storm moved northwards, damaging farms in the area.
Electricity to the area was cut for several hours.
One man was killed during a freak storm which hit the same area in October.
